rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In November 2015
 we issued &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;3.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; notes due 2025
 with net cash proceeds received of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$246.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Interest is payable semiannually in arrears in May and November of each year. Of these notes
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; were subject to interest rate hedges and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of fair value hedges as further disclosed in note 7. The net proceeds from this issuance were used to pay down short-term borrowings and for general corporate purposes. In December of 2015
 proceeds from short-term borrowings were used to pay off &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$200 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;5.20%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; notes that matured in that month.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We have available credit facilities with domestic and foreign banks for various purposes. Some of these lines are committed lines and others are uncommitted lines and could be withdrawn at various times. In June 2015
 we entered into a five-year &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$750 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; revolving credit facility which will expire in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;June 2020&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. The pricing for this credit facility
 on a fully drawn basis
 is LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;0.75%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. This credit facility supports our commercial paper program and
  after &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$356.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; was used to support issued commercial paper
 we have &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$393.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of capacity at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. In addition
 we have several uncommitted lines totaling &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$182.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which have a total unused capacity at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$151.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. These lines by their nature can be withdrawn based on the lenders&amp;#8217; discretion. Committed credit facilities require a fee
 and annual commitment fees were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for 2016 and 2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Rental expense under operating leases (primarily buildings and equipment) was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$41.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$39.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$40.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Future annual fixed rental payments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;sup style=vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:6pt&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for the years ending November&amp;#160;30 are as follows (in millions):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=4 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:92%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:6%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;27.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-top:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2018&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;21.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2019&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;14.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2020&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;11.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2021&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;9.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Thereafter&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;23.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-left:24px;text-indent:-24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;sup style=vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:6pt&gt;(1)      &lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;In July 2016
 we entered into a 15-year lease for a headquarters building in Hunt Valley
 Maryland. The lease
 which is expected to commence upon completion of building construction and fit-out
 currently scheduled for the second half of 2018
 requires monthly lease payments of approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; beginning six months after lease commencement. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; monthly lease payment is subject to adjustment after an initial 60-month period and thereafter on an annual basis as specified in the lease agreement. In addition
 the initial &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; monthly lease payment is subject to increase in the event of agreed-upon changes to specifications related to the headquarters building. We expect to consolidate our Corporate staff and certain non-manufacturing U.S. employees
 currently housed in four locations in the suburban Baltimore
 Maryland area
 to the new headquarters building. Due to uncertainty as to the exact date when the lease will commence
 these lease payments are not reflected in the preceding table of annual fixed rental payments for the years ending November 30
 2017 through 2021 and thereafter.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 we had guarantees outstanding of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; with terms of one year or less. At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 we had outstanding letters of credit&amp;#160;of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$7.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$8.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. These letters of credit typically act as a guarantee of payment to certain third parties in accordance with specified terms and conditions. The unused portion of our letter of credit facility was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$13.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30


 including foreign currency and interest rate exposures
 which exist as part of our ongoing business operations. We do not enter into contracts for trading purposes
 nor are we a party to any leveraged derivative instrument and all derivatives are designated as hedges. We are not a party to master netting arrangements
 and we do not offset the fair value of derivative contracts with the same counterparty in our financial statement disclosures. The use of derivative financial instruments is monitored through regular communication with senior management and the use of written guidelines.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Foreign Currency&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We are potentially exposed to foreign currency fluctuations affecting net investments
 transactions and earnings denominated in foreign currencies. We selectively hedge the potential effect of these foreign currency fluctuations by entering into foreign currency exchange contracts with highly-rated financial institutions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Contracts which are designated as hedges of anticipated purchases denominated in a foreign currency (generally purchases of raw materials in U.S. dollars by operating units outside the U.S.) are considered cash flow hedges. The gains and losses on these contracts are deferred in accumulated other comprehensive income until the hedged item is recognized in cost of goods sold
 at which time the net amount deferred in accumulated other comprehensive income is also recognized in cost of goods sold. Gains and losses from contracts which are designated as hedges of assets
 liabilities or firm commitments are recognized through income
 offsetting the change in fair value of the hedged item.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;During fiscal year 2016
 we entered into fair value foreign currency exchange contracts to hedge the currency component of certain intercompany loans between our subsidiaries. At November 30
 2016
 the notional value of these contracts was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$109.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. During fiscal year 2016
 we recognized a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; loss on the change in fair value of these contracts
 which was offset by a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; gain on the change in the currency component of the underlying loans. Both the loss and the gain were recognized in our consolidated income statement as other income
 net.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At November 30
 2016
 we had foreign currency exchange contracts to purchase or sell &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$449.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of foreign currencies versus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$264.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at November 30
 2015. All of these contracts were designated as hedges of anticipated purchases denominated in a foreign currency or hedges of foreign currency denominated assets or liabilities. Hedge ineffectiveness was not material. At November 30
 2016
 we had &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$189.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of notional contracts that have durations of less than &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;seven&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; days that are used to hedge short-term cash flow funding. The remaining contracts have durations of one to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;twelve&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; months.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Interest Rates&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We finance a portion of our operations with both fixed and variable rate debt instruments
 primarily commercial paper
 notes and bank loans. We utilize interest rate swap agreements to minimize worldwide financing costs and to achieve a desired mix of variable and fixed rate debt.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;During fiscal 2015
 we entered into a total of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of forward starting interest rate swap agreements to manage our interest rate risk associated with the anticipated issuance of fixed rate notes in November 2015. We cash settled all of these agreements
 which were designated as cash flow hedges
 for a loss of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; simultaneous with the issuance of the notes at an all-in effective fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.45%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; on the full &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of debt. The loss on these agreements was deferred in accumulated other comprehensive income and is being amortized to increase interest expense over the life of the notes. Hedge ineffectiveness of these agreements was not material.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In November 2015
 we entered into an interest rate swap contract for a notional amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to receive interest at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and pay a variable rate of interest based on three-month LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.22%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. We designated these swaps
 which expire in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 2025&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 as fair value hedges of the changes in fair value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; medium-term notes due &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2025&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; that we issued in November 2015. Any unrealized gain or loss on these swaps was offset by a corresponding increase or decrease in the value of the hedged debt. Hedge ineffectiveness was not material.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In March 2006
 we entered into interest rate swap contracts for a total notional amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to receive interest at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;5.20%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and pay a variable rate of interest based on three-month LIBOR minus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;0.05%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. We designated these swaps
 which expired in December 2015
 as fair value hedges of the changes in fair value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$200 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;5.20%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; medium-term notes due 2015 that we issued in December 2005. Any unrealized gain or loss on these swaps was offset by a corresponding increase or decrease in the value of the hedged debt. Hedge ineffectiveness was not material.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The following tables disclose the derivative instruments on our balance sheet as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which are all recorded at fair value:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=15 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:22%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:13%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:13%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;As of&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;November&amp;#160;30

The net amount of accumulated other comprehensive income expected to be reclassified into income related to these contracts in the next twelve months is a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; increase to earnings.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The carrying amount and fair value of financial instruments at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30

rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Foreign currency (liabilities)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;5.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;5.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;0.7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;0.7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Because of their short-term nature
 the amounts reported in the balance sheet for cash and cash equivalents
 receivables
 short-term borrowings and trade accounts payable approximate fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Investments in affiliates are not readily marketable
 and it is not practicable to estimate their fair value. Long-term investments are comprised of fixed income and equity securities held on behalf of employees in certain employee benefit plans and are stated at fair value on the balance sheet. The cost of these investments was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$80.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$80.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Concentrations of Credit Risk&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We are potentially exposed to concentrations of credit risk with trade accounts receivable
 prepaid allowances and financial instruments. The customers of our consumer segment are predominantly food retailers and food wholesalers. Consolidations in these industries have created larger customers. In addition
 competition has increased with the growth in alternative channels including mass merchandisers
 dollar stores
 warehouse clubs
 discount chains and e-commerce. This has caused some customers to be less profitable and increased our exposure to credit risk. We have a large and diverse customer base and
 other than with respect to the two customers disclosed in note 16
 each of which accounted for greater than 10% of our consolidated sales
 there was no material concentration of credit risk in these accounts at November 30
 2016. At November 30
 2016


 stock options and company stock awarded as part of our long-term performance plan (LTPP). Total stock-based compensation expense for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$25.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$18.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$18.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. Total unrecognized stock-based compensation expense related to our RSUs and stock options at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$14.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and the weighted-average period over which this will be recognized is &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.3 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Total unrecognized stock-based compensation expense related to our LTPP is variable in nature and is dependent on the company's execution against established performance metrics under performance cycles related to  this plan.  As of November 30
 2016
 we have &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;4.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; shares remaining available for future issuance under our RSUs
 stock option and LTPP award programs.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;For all awards
 forfeiture rates are considered in the calculation of compensation expense.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The following summarizes the key terms and the methods of valuation and expense recognition for each of our stock-based compensation awards.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;RSUs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;RSUs are valued at the market price of the underlying stock
 discounted by foregone dividends
 on the date of grant. Substantially all of the RSUs granted vest over a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year term or upon retirement. Compensation expense is recorded in the income statement ratably over the shorter of the period until vested or the employee's retirement eligibility date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;A summary of our RSU activity for the years ended November&amp;#160;30 follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=16 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:37%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Stock Options&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Stock options are granted with an exercise price equal to the market price of the stock on the date of grant. Substantially all of the options vest ratably over a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year period or upon retirement and are exercisable over a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year period. Upon exercise of the option
 shares are issued from our authorized and unissued shares.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The fair value of the options is estimated with a lattice option pricing model which uses the assumptions in the following table. We believe the lattice model provides an appropriate estimate of fair value of our options as it allows for a range of possible outcomes over an option term and can be adjusted for changes in certain assumptions over time. Expected volatilities are based primarily on the historical performance of our stock. We also use historical data to estimate the timing and amount of option exercises and forfeitures within the valuation model. The expected term of the options is an output of the option pricing model and estimates the period of time that options are expected to remain unexercised. The risk-free interest rate is based on the U.S. Treasury yield curve in effect at the time of grant. Compensation expense is calculated based on the fair value of the options on the date of grant. This compensation is recorded in the income statement ratably over the shorter of the period until vested or the employee's retirement eligibility date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The per share weighted-average fair value for all options granted was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$17.50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$12.52&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$9.48&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. These fair values were computed using the following range of assumptions for our various stock compensation plans for the years ended November&amp;#160;30:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=7 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:58%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Under our stock option plans
 we may issue shares on a net basis at the request of the option holder. This occurs by netting the option cost in shares from the shares exercised.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;A summary of our stock option activity for the years ended November&amp;#160;30 follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=16 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:39%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;As of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 the intrinsic value (the difference between the exercise price and the market price) for all options currently outstanding was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$130.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and for options currently exercisable was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$115.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. At November 30
 2016
 the differences between options outstanding and options expected to vest and their related weighted-average exercise prices
 aggregate intrinsic values and weighted-average remaining lives were not material. The total intrinsic value of all options exercised during the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$25.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$25.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$25.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. A summary of our stock options outstanding and exercisable at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30

254.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1


 such as the market approach (comparable market prices)

 either directly or indirectly. These include quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets and quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in markets that are not active.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8226;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;&gt;Level 3:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; &amp;#160;&amp;#160;Unobservable inputs that reflect management&amp;#8217;s own assumptions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Our population of assets and liabilities subject to fair value measurements on a recurring basis at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; are as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=13 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:48%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;27.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The fair values of insurance contracts are based upon the underlying values of the securities in which they are invested and are from quoted market prices from various stock and bond exchanges for similar type assets. The fair values of bonds and other long-term investments are based on quoted market prices from various stock and bond exchanges. The fair values for interest rate and foreign currency derivatives are based on values for similar instruments using models with market based inputs. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The acquisition-date fair value of the liability for contingent consideration related to our acquisition of D&amp;amp;A was approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$27.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (see note 2) and was included in other long-term liabilities in our consolidated balance sheet. The fair value of the liability both at acquisition and as of each reporting period is estimated using a discounted cash flow technique applied to the expected payout with significant inputs that are not observable in the market and thus represents a Level 3 fair value measurement as defined in the FASB's Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 820
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;&gt;Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; The significant inputs in the Level 3 measurement not supported by market activity included our probability assessments of expected future earnings before interest
 taxes
 depreciation and amortization related to our acquisition of D&amp;amp;A during the calendar 2017 earn-out period
 adjusted for expectations of the amounts and ultimate resolution of likely disputes to be raised by the sellers and by us as provided in the purchase agreement
 discounted considering the uncertainties associated with the obligation
 and calculated in accordance with the terms of the purchase agreement. Changes in the fair value of the liability for contingent consideration including accretion
 but excluding the impact of foreign currency
 will be recognized in income on a quarterly basis until settlement in fiscal 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The change in fair value of our Level 3 liabilities
 which relates solely to the contingent consideration related to our acquisition of D&amp;amp;A
 for the years ended November 30
 2016 and 2015 is summarized as follows (in millions):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.609375%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=24 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:29%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:9pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;Year ended November 30


 if located outside of the U.S.
 with functional currencies other than the U.S. dollar
 asset and liability accounts are translated at the rates of exchange at the balance sheet date and the resultant translation adjustments are included in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss)
 a separate component of shareholders&amp;#8217; equity. Income and expense items are translated at average monthly rates of exchange. Gains and losses from foreign currency transactions of these majority-owned or controlled subsidiaries and affiliates &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;&amp;#8212; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;that is
 transactions denominated in other than the functional currency &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;&amp;#8212; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;are included in net earnings.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Our unconsolidated affiliates located outside the U.S. generally use their local currencies as their functional currencies. The asset and liability accounts of those unconsolidated affiliates are translated at the rates of exchange at the balance sheet date
 with the resultant translation adjustments included in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) of those affiliates. Income and expense items of those affiliates are translated at average monthly rates of exchange. We record our ownership share of the net assets and accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) of our unconsolidated affiliates in our consolidated balance sheet on the lines entitled &amp;#8220;Investments and other assets&amp;#8221; and &amp;#8220;Accumulated other comprehensive loss

171.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;40.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Intangible asset amortization expense was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$11.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$7.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$5.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 finite-lived intangible assets had a weighted-average remaining life of approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;11&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; years.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The changes in the carrying amount of goodwill by segment for the years ended &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; 608.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;background-color:#e0e3f1;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;163.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1


 risk-adjusted discount rates
 assumed royalty rates
 future economic and market conditions and determination of appropriate market comparables. We base our fair value estimates on assumptions we believe to be reasonable but that are unpredictable and inherently uncertain. Actual future results may differ from these estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;&gt;Goodwill Impairment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Our reporting units used to assess potential goodwill impairment are the same as our business segments. We calculate fair value of a reporting unit by using a discounted cash flow model and then compare that to the carrying amount of the reporting unit
 including intangible assets and goodwill. If the carrying amount of the reporting unit exceeds the calculated fair value
 then we would determine the implied fair value of the reporting unit&amp;#8217;s goodwill. An impairment charge would be recognized to the extent the carrying amount of goodwill exceeds the implied fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;&gt;Indefinite-lived Intangible Asset Impairment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Our indefinite-lived intangible assets consist of brand names and trademarks. We calculate fair value by using a relief-from-royalty method or discounted cash flow model and then compare that to the carrying amount of the indefinite-lived intangible asset. If the carrying amount of the indefinite-lived intangible asset exceeds its fair value
 an impairment charge would be recorded to the extent the recorded indefinite-lived intangible asset exceeds the fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;&gt;Long-lived Fixed Asset Impairment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Fixed assets and amortizable intangible assets are reviewed for impairment as events or changes in circumstances occur indicating that the carrying value of the asset may not be recoverable. Undiscounted cash flow analyses are used to determine if an impairment exists. If an impairment is determined to exist


 current federal income tax expense increased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$48.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$78.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in 2015 to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$127.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in 2016. That change was largely offset by a net increase in deferred federal tax benefit of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$38.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 from a deferred expense of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$9.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in 2015 to a deferred benefit of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$29.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in 2016. These changes principally stemmed from higher pretax income in the U.S. in 2016 compared to the prior year as well as to an increase in deductible temporary differences in 2016
 with a resultant increase in deferred tax assets

 net of federal benefits&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Net deferred tax liability&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;background-color:#e0e3f1; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(30.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(53.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 our non-U.S. subsidiaries have tax loss carryforwards of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$137.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Of these carryforwards
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; expire in 2017
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$11.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; from 2018 through 2019
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$39.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; from 2020 through 2027 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$83.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; may be carried forward indefinitely.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 our non-U.S. subsidiaries have capital loss carryforwards of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. All of these carryforwards may be carried forward indefinitely.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:18px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 we have tax credit carryforwards of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$14.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 of which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; expire in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2021&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$13.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2022&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2026&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;A valuation allowance has been provided to record deferred tax assets at their net realizable value based on a more likely than not criteria. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; net decrease in the valuation allowance from 2015 was mainly due to the recognition of deferred tax assets related to subsidiaries' net operating losses which are now more likely than not to be realized
 offset by additional valuation allowance related to losses generated in other subsidiaries in 2016 which may not be realized in future periods.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;U.S. income taxes are not provided for unremitted earnings of international subsidiaries and affiliates where our intention is to reinvest these earnings permanently. Unremitted earnings of such entities were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.64 billion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Upon distribution of these earnings
 we could be subject to both U.S. income taxes and withholding taxes. Determination of the unrecognized deferred income tax liability is not practical because of the complexities involved with this hypothetical calculation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The total amount of unrecognized tax benefits as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$58.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$56.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. If recognized
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$46.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of these tax benefits as of November 30
 2016 would affect the effective tax rate.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The following table summarizes the activity related to our gross unrecognized tax benefits for the years ended November 30:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=10 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:61%;
